duties_responsibilities.duty: Conduct annual plan reviews, investment reviews, and service meetings with clients and brokers.
Act as the escalation point for resolution of non-routine issues related to service, including identifying root causes and designing strategies for resolution.
Consult with clients and brokers on qualified plan design issues and interpret plan provisions to accomplish client goals.
Adhere to process and documentation standards to minimize operational risk and loss.
Drive cross-sell opportunities and consult with clients to enhance profitability.
Assist the Sales team with final presentations, acting as a subject matter expert on company service model, installation process, and plan design.
Contribute to projects designed to enhance service, improve internal training, and improve client satisfaction and retention.
Engage in extensive travel (40%-60%) to meet with clients and brokers.
Train clients on company processes, procedures, and resources, including all systems/technology for participants and plan sponsors.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in a business-related field or equivalent education/experience.
FINRA Series 6 and 63 licenses, or obtain within six months.
Thorough understanding of ERISA and retirement industry trends.
Advanced knowledge of retirement programs and subject matter expertise in plan management, including technical, compliance, administration, investment, and participant solutions.
Proficiency using MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
